recipe.name: Gougeres
recipe.ingredients: 1/2 cup water 40 grams butter 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon sugar Pinch cayenne or chili powder (or more to taste) 64 grams (1/2 cup) flour 2 eggs 56 grams grated cheddar cheese

step.describe: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Have a baking sheet standing by, lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
Put the water, butter, salt, sugar, and cayenne in the bowl.
Scrape down bowl. Add the eggs to the bowl while the machine is running, then add the cheese during the last 10 seconds.

Transfer the mixture to a piping bag with a wide round tip or use a plastic bag with the tip of one corner cut out. Pipe rounds of batter onto the baking sheet, about the size of a cherry tomato or slightly larger. Leave room between the round for the gougeres to puff.
Remove the pan from the oven and allow the gougeres to cool on a rack. These are best when freshly baked, but can be re-crisped in the oven if needed.
